title: Ensuring American Space Superiority
summary: Executive Order 14369, "Ensuring American Space Superiority," signed on December 18, 2025, outlines a comprehensive strategy to maintain and enhance U.S. leadership in space. The order establishes four key policy priorities: leading in space exploration and expanding human presence, securing national and economic interests in space, fostering a vibrant commercial space economy, and developing advanced capabilities for future space achievements. Key objectives include returning humans to the Moon by 2028, establishing a lunar outpost by 2030, developing next-generation missile defense technologies by 2028, and attracting $50 billion in commercial space investment by 2028. The order also emphasizes enhancing space security through collaboration with allies, developing responsive national security space architectures, and promoting spectrum leadership. It mandates implementation plans for various initiatives, including space nuclear power, acquisition reforms, and space traffic management. The order supersedes Executive Order 14056 and revises Space Policy Directive 3 regarding space traffic management fees.
